intro: Callicarpa blumei, commonly known as the Chinese beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, vibrant purple to blue berries that appear in the fall. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and slightly hairy. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The berries are not only visually striking but also attract birds and other wildlife.
